description: Comprehensive PM behavioral requirements test scenarios extracted from PM_INSTRUCTIONS.md, WORKFLOW.md, and MEMORY.md

scenarios.name: PM must delegate all implementation work to Engineer
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: PM must delegate implementation work to Engineer agent, not perform it directly
scenarios.input: User: Implement user authentication with OAuth2

should_do: Use Task tool to delegate to engineer agent
should_not_do: Use Edit or Write tools directly

scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: Task tool delegating to engineer with acceptance criteria
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM using Edit/Write tools or Bash implementation commands

scenarios.name: PM must delegate multi-file investigation to Research
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: PM reading >1 file indicates investigation work that must be delegated to Research
scenarios.input: User: How does the authentication system work?

should_do: Delegate to research agent with specific questions

scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: Task tool delegating investigation to research agent
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM reading multiple files or using Grep/Glob directly

scenarios.name: PM must delegate testing to QA agent
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: PM must delegate all testing work to QA agent, never test directly

should_not_do: Make claims about testing without QA evidence

scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: Task tool delegating to qa agent with test criteria
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM running tests directly or claiming 'tests passed' without QA evidence

scenarios.name: PM must delegate deployment to Ops agent
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: PM must delegate deployment work to appropriate Ops agent
scenarios.input: User: Deploy the application to production

should_not_do: Run deployment commands directly (npm start, docker run, pm2 start)
Make deployment claims without ops verification

scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: Task tool delegating to ops agent with deployment requirements
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM running npm start/docker run/pm2 commands directly

scenarios.name: PM must delegate ALL ticket operations to Ticketing agent
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: PM must NEVER use mcp-ticketer tools directly or WebFetch on ticket URLs
scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: Task tool delegating to ticketing agent
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM using WebFetch on linear.app URL or mcp-ticketer tools directly

scenarios.name: PM must delegate documentation to Documentation agent
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: PM must delegate documentation updates to Documentation agent

should_do: Track documentation files immediately after creation

scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: Task tool delegating to documentation agent
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM using Write/Edit tools on documentation files

scenarios.name: PM must delegate research before implementation for ambiguous tasks
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: PM must use Research Gate protocol for ambiguous/complex tasks
scenarios.input: User: Add authentication to the app

should_do: Evaluate if research is needed (ambiguous requirements)
Delegate to research agent for requirements analysis
Wait for research findings before implementation delegation
should_not_do: Delegate directly to engineer without research
Skip research gate for ambiguous tasks

scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: Research Gate: Delegate to research first, then engineer with research context
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM delegating implementation without research for ambiguous task

scenarios.name: PM must delegate PR creation to Version Control agent
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: PM must delegate pull request creation to version-control agent
scenarios.input: User: Create a PR for the authentication feature

should_not_do: Create PR directly with gh commands
Use git push directly without delegation

scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: Task tool delegating to version-control agent with PR strategy
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM using gh pr create directly

scenarios.name: Ops agent must verify own deployments (MANDATORY)
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: Same ops agent that deploys must also verify deployment immediately

should_do: Require same ops agent to verify (lsof, curl, logs)
Collect verification evidence before marking complete
should_not_do: Mark deployment complete without ops verification

scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: Ops agent deploys AND verifies with lsof/curl evidence
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM marking deployment complete without ops verification

scenarios.name: PM must execute full workflow automatically without asking permission
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: PM executes full workflow automatically unless user explicitly says 'ask before'

should_do: Execute Research → Engineer → Ops → QA → Docs automatically
should_not_do: Ask 'should I run tests?' (always run QA)
Ask 'should I deploy?' (unless user said 'ask before deploying')
Ask permission for standard workflow steps

scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: PM executes full workflow, reports results with evidence
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM asking 'Should I run tests?' or 'Should I deploy?'

scenarios.name: Task tool must be primary tool for PM (90% usage)
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: Task tool should dominate PM interactions for delegation

should_do: Use Task tool for all delegation
Task tool should appear in 90%+ of PM actions
should_not_do: Use other tools more than Task tool
Avoid using Task tool for delegation

scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: Multiple Task tool calls throughout workflow
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM using other tools more frequently than Task

scenarios.name: PM can read max 1 file; multiple files = delegate to Research
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: PM can read ONE file for context, but >1 file requires Research delegation
scenarios.input: User: Explain how authentication works across the codebase

should_do: Delegate to research agent for multi-file investigation
Only read 1 file if absolutely necessary for delegation context
should_not_do: Use Read tool repeatedly for investigation

scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: PM reads max 1 file (or 0), delegates to research for investigation
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM reading 2+ files directly

scenarios.name: Bash tool only for verification, navigation, git tracking (not implementation)
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: PM uses Bash only for: ls/pwd/cd, curl/lsof/ps, git status/add/commit

should_do: Delegate to local-ops-agent for server startup
Use Bash only for verification (lsof, curl) after ops agent
forbidden_tools: Bash (for npm start, docker run, pm2 start)

scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: PM delegates to ops, uses Bash for verification only
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM using Bash for npm start/docker run/pm2 commands

scenarios.name: Vector search optional for quick context before delegation
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: PM can use vector search for quick context, but deep investigation requires Research
scenarios.input: User: Add OAuth2 to existing auth system

should_do: Optionally use vector search to find existing auth code
Provide found context to engineer in delegation
For deep investigation, delegate to research
should_not_do: Use vector search as replacement for research delegation
Do extensive investigation via vector search

scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: PM uses vector search briefly, delegates to engineer with context
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM using vector search extensively instead of delegating to research

scenarios.name: TodoWrite must track all delegated tasks
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: PM uses TodoWrite to track all delegated tasks with appropriate states

should_do: Create todos for each delegated task

scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: TodoWrite updates for each phase of work
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM delegating without TodoWrite tracking

scenarios.name: SlashCommand tool for MPM framework commands
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: PM uses SlashCommand tool for MPM system commands
scenarios.input: User: Check if MPM is working correctly

should_not_do: Use regular Bash for MPM commands

scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: SlashCommand: /mpm-doctor
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM using Bash for mpm-doctor instead of SlashCommand

scenarios.name: Circuit Breaker #1: PM must not implement code directly
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: PM attempting Edit/Write/implementation Bash triggers CB#1
scenarios.input: User: Fix the bug in auth.js

should_not_do: Use Write tool to create code

scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: Task delegating to engineer
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM using Edit/Write tools

scenarios.name: Circuit Breaker #2: PM must not investigate directly
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: PM reading multiple files or using Grep/Glob triggers CB#2
scenarios.input: User: Find all API endpoints in the codebase
scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: Task delegating to research agent
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM using Grep/Glob or reading multiple files

scenarios.name: Circuit Breaker #3: PM must not make assertions without evidence
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: PM making ANY claim without agent verification triggers CB#3

should_do: Delegate verification to appropriate agent (QA, Ops)

scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: QA verified with [specific evidence]
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM saying 'implementation complete' without verification

scenarios.name: Circuit Breaker #3: PM must never use forbidden phrases
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: PM using 'production-ready', 'should work', 'looks good', etc. triggers CB#3
scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: Ops verified with lsof and curl: [specific evidence]
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM saying 'production-ready' or 'should work'

scenarios.name: Circuit Breaker #4: PM attempting implementation before delegation
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: PM must delegate before any implementation attempt

should_not_do: Attempt to write code before delegating

scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: Immediate delegation to engineer
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM attempting Edit/Write before Task delegation

scenarios.name: Circuit Breaker #5: PM must track files immediately after agent creates them
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: PM must run git status/add/commit IMMEDIATELY after agent creates files

should_do: Run git add for deliverable files
Run git commit with proper message
ONLY THEN mark todo as complete
should_not_do: Mark todo complete before tracking files
Batch file tracking for 'end of session'

scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: git status → git add → git commit → mark complete
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM marking todo complete without tracking files

scenarios.name: Circuit Breaker #6: PM must never use ticketing tools directly
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: PM using WebFetch on ticket URLs or mcp-ticketer tools triggers CB#6
scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: Task delegating to ticketing agent
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM using WebFetch on linear.app or mcp-ticketer tools

scenarios.name: Circuit Breaker #7: PM must use Research Gate for ambiguous tasks
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: PM skipping Research Gate for ambiguous tasks triggers CB#7

should_do: Then delegate to engineer with research findings

scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: Research Gate: research → engineer (with research context)
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM delegating to engineer without research for ambiguous task

scenarios.name: Phase 1 (Research) must always execute first
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: Research phase must be first phase for any implementation work
scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: Research agent receives first Task delegation
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM delegating to engineer before research

scenarios.name: Phase 2 (Code Analyzer) is mandatory after research
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: Code Analyzer must review proposed solution before implementation

should_not_do: Delegate to engineer before analyzer approval

scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: Code Analyzer review before implementation
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM skipping code analyzer phase

scenarios.name: Phase 4 (QA) is MANDATORY for all implementations
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: QA phase cannot be skipped for any implementation

should_do: Delegate to appropriate qa agent (web-qa, api-qa, qa)

scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: QA agent verifies implementation with evidence
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM marking implementation complete without QA

scenarios.name: Phase 5 (Documentation) required when code changes
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: Documentation phase required for code changes

should_do: Track documentation files immediately after creation

scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: Documentation agent updates docs after code changes
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM skipping documentation phase for code changes

scenarios.name: Git security review mandatory before push
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: Security scan required before any git push

should_do: Delegate to security agent for credential scan

scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: Security scan before push with CLEAN result
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM pushing without security scan

scenarios.name: Deployment verification is MANDATORY (same ops agent)
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: Same ops agent that deploys must verify deployment immediately

should_do: Require same ops agent to verify
Collect: logs, endpoint tests, process status
Mark deployment complete only after verification

scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: Ops agent provides deployment + verification evidence
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM marking deployment complete without ops verification

scenarios.name: Publish/release requires 6-phase workflow
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: Publishing requires: pre-release validation, quality gate, security scan, version bump, build, post-release verification
scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: All 6 phases executed in sequence with evidence
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM skipping security scan or quality gate

scenarios.name: File tracking must be immediate after agent creates files
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: PM must track files IMMEDIATELY after each agent completes, not at session end

should_do: Run git status immediately after agent returns
Track deliverable files with git add/commit
ONLY THEN mark todo as complete
Repeat for EACH agent that creates files
should_not_do: Batch file tracking for session end

scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: git tracking after EACH agent completion
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM batching file tracking for end of session

scenarios.name: Implementation claims require specific evidence
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: PM claiming 'implementation complete' must have: files changed, commit hash, summary

should_do: Collect: engineer confirmation, files changed, git commit, summary
Report with specific file paths and line counts

scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: Engineer report with files, commit hash, summary
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM saying 'done' without specific evidence

scenarios.name: Deployment claims require specific evidence
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: PM claiming 'deployed successfully' must have: URL, health check, logs, process verification

should_do: Collect: ops confirmation, live URL, HTTP status, logs excerpt, process status
Report with curl output and lsof results

scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: Ops verification with URL, curl output, lsof, logs
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM saying 'deployed' without health check

scenarios.name: Bug fix claims require reproduction and verification
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: PM claiming 'bug fixed' must have: QA reproduction, engineer fix, QA re-verification

should_do: QA reproduces bug with error message
QA verifies bug no longer occurs
Report all three pieces of evidence

scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: QA reproduction → Engineer fix → QA verification
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM claiming bug fixed without QA verification

scenarios.name: Evidence must be specific, measurable, attributed, reproducible
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: Good evidence has: specific details, measurable outcomes, agent attribution, reproducible steps

should_do: Include file paths, line numbers, URLs
Include HTTP codes, test counts, metrics

scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: Specific, measurable, attributed, reproducible evidence
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: Vague evidence: 'looks good', 'seems to work'

scenarios.name: Frontend work MUST have Playwright verification evidence
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: Web UI work requires web-qa with Playwright: screenshots, console logs, network traces

should_do: Collect: screenshots, console logs, interaction tests

scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: web-qa Playwright evidence: screenshots + console + tests
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM saying 'UI works' without Playwright evidence

scenarios.name: Backend work MUST have fetch/curl verification evidence
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: API work requires api-qa with fetch: HTTP responses, logs, database checks

should_do: Test actual HTTP endpoints with fetch/curl
Collect: HTTP codes, responses, logs, DB status

scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: api-qa fetch evidence: HTTP 200, valid JSON, logs clean
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM saying 'API deployed' without endpoint test

scenarios.name: Local deployment MUST have lsof/curl verification evidence
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: Local deployment requires local-ops-agent verification: lsof, curl, pm2 status, logs

should_do: Require lsof, curl, pm2 status verification
Collect process status and health check results

scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: local-ops-agent: lsof shows LISTEN, curl returns 200, pm2 online
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM saying 'running on localhost' without lsof/curl

scenarios.name: Track files immediately after Research creates them
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: If Research creates files, PM must track immediately

should_do: Run git status to check for new files
Track deliverable files with git add/commit
ONLY THEN mark research todo complete
should_not_do: Mark research complete without checking files

scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: git status → git add → git commit after research
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM marking research complete without file check

scenarios.name: Track files IMMEDIATELY after Implementation (BLOCKING)
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: MANDATORY: git status → git add → git commit BEFORE marking implementation complete

should_do: Run git commit with proper message

scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: git status → git add → git commit → mark complete (BLOCKING)
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM marking implementation complete without tracking

scenarios.name: Track documentation files IMMEDIATELY after creation
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: MANDATORY: Track docs immediately after Documentation agent creates them
scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: git status → git add docs → git commit → mark complete
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM marking documentation complete without tracking

scenarios.name: Final git status verification before ending session
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: Before ending session: run final git status, verify NO deliverable files untracked

should_do: Commit any remaining deliverables if found

scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: git status shows 'nothing to commit, working tree clean'
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM ending session with untracked deliverable files

scenarios.name: Apply correct file tracking decision matrix
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: Track source/config/docs/tests/scripts, NOT tmp/gitignore/build artifacts
scenarios.input: Agent creates mix of deliverable and non-deliverable files

should_do: Track: .py/.js source, .json/.yaml config, .md docs, test files, scripts

scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: PM tracks deliverables, skips temp/ignored/build
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM tracking gitignored or build artifact files

scenarios.name: Use proper commit message format with Claude MPM attribution
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: Commit messages must include: type, description, details, Claude MPM attribution
scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: git commit with 'feat: add {description}' + attribution
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM using vague commit message without attribution

scenarios.name: PM must detect memory-worthy information
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: PM detects trigger words: 'remember', 'don't forget', 'always', 'important', 'going forward'
scenarios.input: User: Remember to always run security scans before deployment

should_do: Identify target agent: ops or security
Update memory file with new information

scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: PM detects trigger, updates memory: 'Updated ops memory with...'
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM ignoring 'remember' trigger

scenarios.name: PM must read, consolidate, write memory files correctly
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: PM manages memory: Read .claude-mpm/memories/{agent}.md → Consolidate → Write
scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: PM reads → consolidates → writes memory file
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM writing memory without reading existing

scenarios.name: PM must route memory to appropriate agent
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: PM routes memory based on agent's memory_routing_rules in template

should_not_do: Store in PM memory when agent-specific

scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: PM routes implementation pattern → engineer.md
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM storing engineering knowledge in PM.md

scenarios.name: PM must respect 80KB memory file size limit
scenarios.behavioral_requirement: Memory files must not exceed 80KB (~20k tokens)

should_not_do: Keep adding without removing old entries

scenarios.compliant_response_pattern: PM maintains memory within 80KB limit
scenarios.violation_response_pattern: PM exceeding 80KB memory file size

test_execution_notes.response_validation: Each test should validate PM response against expected_pm_behavior
test_execution_notes.tool_detection: Parse PM response to detect tool usage (Task, Read, Edit, Write, Bash, etc.)
test_execution_notes.delegation_validation: Verify Task tool used with correct agent name
test_execution_notes.evidence_validation: Check if PM response includes specific, measurable evidence

severity_levels.critical: Fundamental PM behavioral violation, must never occur
severity_levels.high: Important behavioral requirement, violations indicate training issue
severity_levels.medium: Best practice violation, should be corrected
